thread.title: UCLA: Injury status unclear for Perkins, Fuller, Savaiinaea
thread.title_full: UCLA: Injury status unclear for Perkins, Fuller, Savaiinaea - Press Enterprise

author: JOEY KAUFMAN
title: UCLA: Injury status unclear for Perkins, Fuller, Savaiinaea
text:
BY JOEY KAUFMAN / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 23, 2015 Updated: 10:54 p.m. UCLA running back Paul Perkins suffered an injury to his left knee in the Bruins’ 40-24 win over No. 20 Cal on Thursday night, and a day later, the extent of the injury remains unclear.
In his news conference after the game, Coach Jim Mora said only that the status of Perkins, along with UCLA’s other injured players, was “not good.”
A report published Friday afternoon by Bruin Report Online said the fourth-year junior suffered a bone bruise. Perkins was scheduled to undergo an MRI earlier in the day. The Scout.com website added that there was no ligament damage.
The status of inside linebacker Isaako Savaiinaea, who was carted to the locker room with what appeared to be a serious leg injury, and receiver Devin Fuller (neck) are also unknown.
Mora’s scheduled day-after-game teleconference with reporters was canceled..
Perkins left in the second quarter of Thursday’s game after he was hit just above his left knee by a Cal player’s helmet.
Trainers tended to him for several minutes on the field, before he walked to the sideline without help. He was limping, though. After further examination, he rode a stationary bike, and did not return.
In place of Perkins, freshman Soso Jamabo carried the ball 18 times for 79 yards and one touchdown.
“We’re just going to continue to get better,” Jamabo said after the game. “When he comes back, we’ll be ready to have him. We’ll welcome him with open arms, and we’ll be great.”
Perkins’ backup, sophomore Nate Starks, also was out with a head injury sustained in a loss at Stanford on Oct. 15.
Last season, Perkins led the Pac-12 in rushing (1,572 yards). Through seven games this fall, he has a team-high 754 yards and eight touchdowns, including 73 yards on 11 carries against Cal.
Contact the writer: jkaufman@ocregister.com
